review: The UI/UX of the app is really bad. It offers less features than the website overall, and unlike other applications, it forcibly captures ALL github links without offering to go to Chrome first. Actually opening the website on Chrome is a challenge now. BUT I can't uninstall it if I want to keep the two factor token it provides. I hate it.

The functionality is still pretty limited. But what is there works without any flaw. I would really appreciate an overview over the github actions and at least a simplified kanban board. As soon as the mobile app reaches a greater feature set, I'll be happy to give more stars. TLDR quality software but still limited features
Decent. Not as intuitive as the website, and a few features are missing. Usually I just end up opening GitHub up in the chrome mobile browser since it's easier to do things there

Has pretty much everything you'd need for quickly referencing things on the go. Obviously not as robust as the desktop app, but absolutely does the trick. It's nice being able to review and merge PRs through the app.

First of all, why cannot you enable the same amount of notifications as via email? That is missing Second, There is clearly an api issue. I have a triage role in org, but in app I cannot even change a label due to permission error. I have to open mobile browser to do that. Button to share feedback via community doesn't work, since there is no guarantee that somebody will pick it up. My question is untouched for months

The Approve popup for Two factor authentication doesn't automatically pop up or show as notification in the taskbar or dropdown notification. I have to launch the app first and still refresh the app so I can see the popup. It's annoying sometimes.

I've used it for a year or two, but I'm uninstalling now because it's still an extremely frustrating experience compared to the Mobile web or even the "Desktop site" in Chrome. Missing functionality, buttons, cannot share code, deeplink, highlight lines, navigate easily. Oftentimes I got stuck in the app, with the back not putting me back to where I was. Automatic capturing of GitHub links means that I can't escape the app even in situations I know can't use it. Please make the app open-source!

Use to be great platform but I own my account since 2017, have nothing bad on my account. Actually nothing had changed with my account since 2017, only thing I added was a guide on steam deck windows guide and my account got flagged. I contact the support and no reply back for over 1 week. I give up on github. To this day I'm still waiting for a reply the ticket is still open and account still flagged.

I feel bad, the PC version of this we use for work but the mobile version is genuinely one of the most frustrating app experiences I've had in years. Hard to find anything, no obvious way to change an issues category within a project, things aren't where you expect them to be or just flat out can't be changed. Others might have a fine experience but I did not, sorry devs! Coming from a fellow dev I hate writing bad reviews, but this one really frustrated me to no end :/.

Works good as expected, with a couple of hiccups: 1. I couldn't find the funcion to download a repo as a zip file. 2. Markdown Math Symbols (such as $/frac{x}{y} $) are not being rendered at all, although the browser version has no problem with them.
the best way to keep up with progress on your team's codebase. the notifications are instant and the interface allows you to respond to comments quickly and easily. highly recommend
An excellent smooth Github experience on mobile, and the team behind it has been improving it with most important features of the web version in this app.
no way to view names of the long files, I understand they are being cropped, but filename is critical during review phase, should be possible to see the full name/path of the file
It was working in my other phone but when I clicked sign in with GitHub, the button does not work, it does not do anything. Please help me fix this.
Forces you to use for 2fa method despite existing options. No way to disable in app 2fa without signing out of the app. Issue has been ignored since 1st Feb on the issue tracker. Uninstalling.
Like the app, tho I just tried to open an Action build log and I kid you not the smooth scroll ran for 45 seconds before hitting the bottom, perhaps just jump instantly to the bottom instead?
The app is fine, but it's just a bit odd to navigate. I can't quite get the notifications to do what I want. But it is cool to be able to merge PRs from your phone.
All good but the image upload feature is not working properly and still lack of features such as native push notification when there is new notification on GitHub.

Great App. Currently I'm unable to view files over 10 mb, it shows "Could not resolve files over 10 mb". Edit: Another feature request: It would really help if we are able to edit the files, or atleast the markdown files if not all.
I'm not a tech but I learn slowly by github and I want to learn more I want to give 5 stars for a very talented teams Cheers and keep up your good works.
Nicely made up that has a lot of functionality. Allows me to review and manage pull requests easily away from my pc
still has some bugs. And binary files don't show. But it has improved a lot!!

GitHub gets a 5 STAR GRADE with the very best security measures with team members being too damn aware of some of the worst things possible with internet applications ! This is a HUGE REASON why I came knocking on Github's doors once again ! I certainly want safe internet applications for everyone to include the US Government telling their resources they were vulnerable as myself actively going through a great deal of internet drama not needed ! Well in due time Homeland and FEDERAL RES HACKED!
Github on the browser is just so much better. There are little to no features & it's incredibly difficult to move around, I have no idea what does what.

There's a lot of difference between GitHub mobile app and desktop. There are very very less functions in GitHub mobile app. Even we can't edit or manage repository (Can't private or public repository). Please make this app work like as it works in desktop.

How is there not a search page for text function when viewing code? This is the github app, you would think it would be top notch. Better off uninstalling the app and using the browser version on your phone.
The worst mobile version of any app. The web version is far better than this and has lots of options. Even there's no preview option available for repository for mobile version. Looool.
Missing some functionality from the web version, but usually does almost everything you may ever need to do from mobile.
Needs tabs and improved navigation, including an option to go to the web site, even when the app is the default choice for GitHub links.
Sufficient for a subset of frequent actions, but I find myself shifting to a web browser half the time due to missing functionality: external workflows, batched commit suggestions, ...

Pointless so far. Wanted a way to sync an Obsidian vault and GitHub would be the best way given that Obsidian is text based and I want to delete files when I delete them and move files when I move them (rather than copy them) - same for renaming. All things that Google Drive just doesn't do. Problem is that there's just no reasonable way to sync my notes from my phone back to GitHub. I can't even use this app to download them in the first place. The website is so much better.

Web version is way better, even if not optimized well for mobile users. I can't even manage my repositories or settings. Pros: it's very lightweight and optimized. Cons: It's exploring-only, without main functions.

Just fails to be useful. Lacks the core basics that would give this app any sort of meaning. Right now, it's like an incomplete web browser that just avoids all useful features for programming design simplicity at the cost of user experience.
I use it and like it. But navigation is not smooth, also the pull request UI is not too user friendly. I miss a way to see the comments in a quick way, for example.

We all know that GitHub is the best version and the source control fot hosting git services. The one thing is that GitHub app should able to give an option to create a repository which makes it far more usable and feasible to use.
What's up with the new update? The sign-in buttons are not clickable. Can't you test the app before pushing a new update. üò†
I prefer downloading from F-Droid. I mean, how do you even navigate this site, it's so cluttered and difficult.
I wish they would explain how to use the app a little more. I'm only a beginner but I am extremely confused about almost everything.
The app is very nice overall, im just missing one key feature: opening the directory containing files touched in pull requests. Not have the ability to do so really slows me down.
Not bad, but too small functionality. For ex. u can't navigate in file with u fingers, only scroll up and down, and no smooth resize just a few sizes of text selected in options
